intro: Neckia malayana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed neckia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
